intro: Eurybia chasei, commonly known as the rock ptarmigan, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Eurybia chasei plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
